description: From Latin marmoreus (“of, pertaining to, consisting of or made of marble; resembling marble; adorned with statues”) + English -al (suffix forming adjectives). Marmoreus is derived from marmor (“block or piece of marble; marble building or statue”) (from Ancient Greek μάρμᾰρος (mármaros, “marble”)) + -eus (suffix forming adjectives from nouns).

adjectives.description: marmoreal (comparative more marmoreal, superlative most marmoreal) (literary)

entries.meaning: Resembling marble or a marble statue; cold, smooth, white, etc.; marblelike.
